title: £1bn Japan fund manager: I lost 80pc in three years because one stock went bust
text:
Japan has been one of the worst-performing stock markets over the past two decades, as deflation and low productivity have led to a dwindling economy. Most funds focusing on the country have struggled and investors’ patience has been tested. That is, unless, they invested in Legg Mason Japan Equity.

While the Topix stock market index has risen just 91pc since the £986m fund was launched in 1996, this portfolio has returned a staggering 641pc. Its 75-year old manager Hideo Shiozumi tells us why the fund has triumphed over the market and how he hopes to do so in the future.

What makes you different?
